main event: A UFO report from 6 November 1957 in Westbury L.I., N.Y. involved the ground-radar observation of 2 unidentified objects for 10 minutes.
interesting points: The observation was conducted using ground-radar.
The duration of the observation was 10 minutes, allowing for a detailed assessment.
The report concluded that further investigation was necessary and listed possible explanations as aircraft, balloon, or satellite.
The document states the need for further investigation to determine the identity and explanation of the sighting.
The report emphasizes that the time of day and location of the sighting were unknown.
